akn:section.akn:heading: Energy resources of Caribbean and Pacific insular areas

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Congressional findings The Congress finds that—
(b) Congressional declaration of policy The Congress declares that it is the policy of the Federal Government to—

(c) Comprehensive energy plan The Secretary of Energy or any administrative official who may succeed him shall prepare a comprehensive energy plan with emphasis on indigenous renewable sources of energy for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, the Northern Mariana Islands, the Federated States of Micronesia, the Marshall Islands and Palau. The plan shall be prepared with the approval of the Secretary of the Interior and in cooperation with the chief executive officer of each insular area by—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Demonstration of cost effective renewable energy technologies

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Demonstration of cost effective renewable energy technologies The Secretary of Energy or any administrative official who may succeed him, with the approval of the Secretary of the Interior, as part of the comprehensive energy planning may demonstrate those indigenous renewable energy technologies which are determined to be most cost effective through the use of existing programs and may implement any projects or programs contained in recommendations of the plan.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Updating of plans; submission to Congress

akn:content.akn:p: (e) Updating of plans; submission to Congress
(f) Authorization of appropriations There are hereby authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this section.
